selected_quotes: Our seafood is caught further and further away from where it is consumed. By Reg Watson
Seafood consumption per person has gone way up over time, especially in China USA
Watson: marine seafood is coming from further and further away over time
Those endlessly-bountiful oceans of the 1970s are in fact depleting alarmingly: @extinctsymbol @DanielJThirkell

citation.abstract: The growing human population must be fed, but historic land-based systems struggle to meet expanding demand. Marine production supports some of the world's poorest people but increasingly provides for the needs of the affluent, either directly by fishing or via fodder-based feeds for marine and terrestrial farming. Here we show the expanding footprint of humans to utilize global ocean productivity to feed themselves. Our results illustrate how incrementally each year, marine foods are sourced farther from where they are consumed and moreover, require an increasing proportion of the ocean's primary productivity that underpins all marine life. Though mariculture supports increased consumption of seafood, it continues to require feeds based on fully exploited wild stocks. Here we examine the ocean's ability to meet our future demands to 2100 and find that even with mariculture supplementing near-static wild catches our growing needs are unlikely to be met without significant changes.
citation.title: Marine foods sourced from farther as their use of global ocean primary production increases
